incidents.name: Increased latency on a single Management API shard

incident_updates.body: Some customers on single shared database experienced errors and increased latency on the Content Management API (CMA) today between 8:30 and 14:00 CET. The API is back operating as normal and we don't expect any further impact.

incidents.name: Issues with some Contentful Apps and UI Extensions not working

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A bug was introduced which affected Apps and UI extensions for the following locations: field, editor, sidebar. We deployed a fix which has resolved the issue but we will continue to monitor.
We have identified the root cause of the issue affecting Field Apps and implemented a fix.
We are currently investigating an issue with some Contentful Apps not working

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The root cause of the issue has been identified and solutions are being validated.
This issue with file uploads on the WebApp continues to affect some customers. The resolution is still being worked on.

Some customers are experiencing failures or increased errors when trying to upload files to Contentful through the WebApp. This is related to an issue with a 3rd party provider. We are working with them to resolve the issue.

incidents.name: Connection issues on Contentful APIs

incident_updates.body: A CDN issue was identified as the source of the issue, which was reported as fixed within 10 minutes of the start of the event. If you are still experiencing issues connecting to our APIs or logging into Contentful please reach out to Customer Support.
Our provider has applied a fix and we are monitoring the situation.
Traffic levels are almost back to normal but we are still seeing failures in our monitoring, we continue to investigate.
Between 22:59 and 23:10 UTC our monitoring systems detected connection failures to our main APIs. We are investigating a possible issue with our CDN layer.

incidents.name: Issues with Content Management API (CMA)

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The fix has now been fully implemented and the Content Management API is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor.
We have rolled out a fix but some customers still may be receiving 403 (Access forbidden) responses on the CMA. We are working on resolving these cases.

incidents.name: Issues with scheduled Publish/Un-publish actions

incident_updates.body: A bug was introduced in how we query the list of scheduled actions which we show on the Contentful WebApp. We incorrectly returned old failed and successful actions (and not just scheduled ones). We implemented a fix and the issue is now resolved - there was no impact to customers scheduled actions/events.
We identified the source of the issue, and pushed a change to fix the problem with scheduled actions. We are continuing to monitor to ensure no more customers are experiencing issues.
Some customers are seeing unknown scheduled publish/un-publish actions appearing on all entries. We are currently investigating the issue.

We've implemented a fix and are monitoring the results.
We've identified the issue and are working on a fix.

incidents.name: Some Content Delivery API responses missing fields when using the select operator

incident_updates.body: A change to the Content Delivery API resulted in some API responses missing data for 1.5 hours (08:19 UTC to 10:09 UTC). This change has been reverted and responses should be normal now. Customers who use the `select` and `includes` operators may need to trigger a cache invalidation if they continue to see issues due to cached responses.

incidents.name: Issues with the Contentful Web App and Asset rendering

incident_updates.body: We've resolved an issue with the WebApp loading entries and assets. We've also purged cache on our CDN. Customers should not be receiving erroneously cached responses anymore. If you are continuing to see issues, please reach out to our support.

We purged the cache at our CDN layer. Customers should not receive erroneously cached responses anymore. Please reach out directly to Support if you are still experiencing unexpected behaviour with Assets and Entries.
If any customers are still experiencing issues with Assets rendering or responses in the content delivery api or the graphql api with a total value of -1, then please republish the asset/entry.”
If any customers are still experiencing issues with Assets rendering or stale data, then please republish the asset/entry.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The impact to Delivery and GraphQL API is still minimal and only impacts uncached requests.

incidents.name: Partial outage affecting Content Delivery and Management APIs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues. Any customer who are still experiencing degraded performance with Contentful Services should reach out to our support team.

We have seen recovery across our main APIs (CMA, CDA and GraphAPI) for customers that were impacted. We are still seeing some degraded performance on Contentful Apps which have external dependencies. We will continue to monitor the situation until we are sure we back to normal operation for all Services
We have been able to mitigate the impact for customers who were seeing errors on Content Delivery API (CDA). Some customers are still seeing impact on CMA, GraphAPI, and Contentful Apps.
We continue to have our on-call engineering team working on mitigating the impact from this large Cloud Provider.
We are still looking into methods to mitigate impact for all customers affected by this outage.
We are still working on mitigating the impact of the major Cloud provider. We do not currently have an ETA yet on full recovery of our services.
We are still working on mitigation efforts to limit the impact of the Cloud Provider outage.
We are continuing to work on mitigating steps to reduce the impact of the ongoing incident with one of our major cloud providers.
We are now also seeing impact on our Delivery API and GraphQL API. We have identified the cause as relating to an ongoing major incident with one of our major cloud providers.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are experiencing an outage on our Management API, which also impacts our Web App and Compose and Launch apps.
